INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff Person 1 pushed Youth A after being hit.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 01/05/2023. It states an incident occurring on
01/03/2023 between Youth A and Staff Person 1 in which Youth A hit
Staff Person 1 in the face and that Staff Person 1 pushed him resulting
in him hitting his head. Youth A did not have any injuries, marks, or
bruises from being pushed and hitting his head and Youth A refused to
go to the hospital.
2

I reviewed incident report dated 01/03/2023. It states Youth A was
being disruptive and refusing to go into his bedroom. Staff Person 2
informed Youth A that his game would be taken away if his negative
behaviors continued. Youth A attempted to take the game away from
Staff Person 2 and then aggressively hit Staff Person 1 in the face with
a closed fist. Youth A then attempted to leave the floor and
aggressively charge at Staff Person 1 who held her hands up in a
protective stance. Youth A ran into Staff Person 1 falling to the floor
and hitting his head on his bedroom door.
I attempted to interview Youth A onsite on 01/05/2023 with DHHS
Worker. He did not want to be interviewed as he was sick. Youth A
was then interviewed onsite on 01/13/2023 with this writer and DHHS
Worker. He reports being inside his bedroom with Staff Person 2 when
he reached over Staff Person 2 to Staff Person 1 who was standing in
his doorway noting that he does like her. Youth A then stated that Staff
Person 2 exited the bedroom and that he also attempted to exit the
bedroom calmly at which time Staff Person 1 pushed him for no reason.
Youth A contradicts himself by saying that he was attempting to leave
the bedroom to get calm. Youth A states that he fell to the floor
bumping his head to his bedroom door and states he was crying. He
then reports getting up and then entering his bedroom. Youth A states
he refused to see a doctor though notes that Staff Person 1 was aware
of his head having a bump though does not recall when she saw it.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite on 01/05/2023 with DHHS Worker.
She reports being employed by the facility five months though has
worked at another company facility for four years with no disciplinary
issues. She also reports being up to date on her required Therapeutic
Crisis Intervention training. Staff Person 1 reports Youth A being upset
and having mood-swings the evening of 01/03/2023 during bedtime
procedures as he was walking in and out of his bedroom. She reports
Staff Person 2 was inside his bedroom taking away a game and that
she was standing in the doorway. She reports Youth A reached around
Staff Person 2 and punched her in the face as she just stood there.
Staff Person 1 reports Staff Person 2 addressed Youth A’s behaviors
with consequences and that Staff Person 2 exited the bedroom. Staff
Person 1 stated she stood just outside Youth A’s bedroom when he ran
out and charged right at her. Staff Person 1 reports raising her arms in
a protective stance when Youth A ran into her and that he fell on his
butt and bumped his head to his bedroom door. Staff Person 1 denies
pushing Youth A purposefully to the floor as he alleges.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 onsite on 01/05/2023 with DHHS Worker.
4

She reports being inside Youth A’s bedroom as he began tearing it up
because he was not allowed to have his game anymore and he was
stating how he did not like Staff Person 1. Staff Person 2 reports
standing in between Youth A and Staff Person 1 when Youth A reached
over her shoulder to punch Staff Person 1 who was just standing there.
She reports Staff Person 1 removed herself from the doorway area and
stood in the hall. Staff Person 2 left the bedroom and proceeded to
walk down the hall when she heard Youth A exclaim how much he
didn’t like Staff Person 1. Staff Person 2 reports turning around and
observing Staff Person 1 in a protective stance and Youth A standing
there. Staff Person 2 states she did not observe Youth A falling or
being on the ground and notes that he walked back inside his bedroom.
Later on in the evening Staff Person 2 reports observing Youth A sitting
in the hallway and that he did report being pushed by Staff Person 1.
She reports the next day that Youth A informed her that his head was
hurting because of being allegedly pushed by Staff Person 1 the
previous night. Youth A declined seeing medical personnel.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 01/13/2023 with DHHS Worker. He
states he was standing in the hallway when Youth A came out of his
bedroom and rushed toward Staff Person 1. He reports Staff Person 1
put her hands out in front of her and that Youth A ran into her and that
he clumsily fell. Youth B states Staff Person 1 did not push Youth A as
he alleges. Youth B also states that minutes prior Youth A reached
over Staff Person 2 and punched Staff Person 1 in the face.
I interviewed Youth C onsite on 01/13/2023 with DHHS Worker. He
states being inside his bedroom with the door closed and observed the
alleged incident involving Staff Person 1 and Youth A through his
window. Youth C states Youth B wanted to leave the floor and ran out
of his bedroom when Staff Person 1 grabbed him and threw him into
the door.
I viewed the area in front of Youth A’s bedroom where he fell with
DHHS Worker. The positioning of Youth C’s door window would not
have allowed him to view Youth A run into Staff Person 1 as he reports
observing from inside his bedroom.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to support Youth A’s allegations that
Staff Person 1 pushed him on purpose causing him to fall to the floor
and bump his head. According to Staff Persons 1 and 2 and Youth B,
Youth A ran out of his bedroom and charged at Staff Person 1 who
positioned her hands in a protective stance and did not push him.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLSIHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
